trans-unit.source: Encapsulates the HTTP intrinsic object that enables information to be shared across multiple requests and sessions within an ASP.NET application.
The <xref:System.Web.HttpApplicationStateWrapper> class derives from the <xref:System.Web.HttpApplicationStateBase> class and serves as a wrapper for the <xref:System.Web.HttpApplicationState> class.
This class exposes the functionality of the <xref:System.Web.HttpApplicationState> class while also exposing the <xref:System.Web.HttpApplicationStateBase> type.

The <xref:System.Web.HttpApplicationStateBase> class enables you to replace the original implementation of the <xref:System.Web.HttpApplicationState> class in your application with a custom implementation, such as when you perform unit testing outside the ASP.NET pipeline.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.HttpApplicationStateWrapper"></xref> class.
The object that this wrapper class provides access to.
httpApplicationState is `null`.
Adds an object to the collection.
The name of the object to add to the collection.
The value of the object.
Gets the keys for the objects in the collection.
An array of state object keys.
Removes all objects from the collection.
Gets a reference to the <xref href="System.Web.HttpApplicationStateBase"></xref> object.
This property provides compatibility with earlier versions of ASP.
A reference to the <xref href="System.Web.HttpApplicationState"></xref> object.
Copies the elements of the collection to an array, starting at the specified index in the array.
The one-dimensional array that is the destination for the elements that are copied from the collection.
The array must have zero-based indexing.
The zero-based index in array at which to begin copying.
array is `null`.
index is less than zero.
array is multidimensional.
-or-
The number of elements in the source object is greater than the available space from index to the end of the destination array.
The type of the source <xref href="System.Web.HttpApplicationStateWrapper"></xref> object cannot be cast to the type of the destination array.
Gets the number of objects in the collection.
The number of objects in the collection.
Returns a state object by index.
The index of the application state object to get.
The object referenced by index.
index is outside the valid range of indexes for the collection.
Returns a state object by name.
The name of the object to get.
The object referenced by name, if found; otherwise, `null`.
Returns an enumerator that can be used to iterate through a collection.
An object that can be used to iterate through the collection.
Returns the name of a state object by index.
The index of the application state object to get.
The name of the application state object.
index is outside the valid range of indexes for the collection.
Returns the data that is necessary to serialize the <xref href="System.Web.HttpApplicationStateWrapper"></xref> object.

A <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> object that contains the information that is required to serialize the <xref href="System.Web.HttpApplicationStateWrapper"></xref> object.

A <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext"></xref> object that contains the source and destination of the serialized stream that is associated with the <xref href="System.Web.HttpApplicationStateWrapper"></xref> object.
Gets a value that indicates whether access to the collection is thread-safe.
`true` if access is synchronized (thread-safe); otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
Gets a state object by index.
The index of the object in the collection.
The object referenced by index.
index is outside the valid range of indexes for the collection.
Gets a state object by name.
The name of the object in the collection.
The object referenced by name, if found; otherwise, `null`.

Gets a <xref href="System.Collections.Specialized.NameObjectCollectionBase.KeysCollection"></xref> instance that contains all the keys in the <xref href="System.Web.HttpApplicationStateWrapper"></xref> instance.
A collection of all the keys in the collection.
Locks access to objects in the collection in order to enable synchronized access.
Raises the deserialization event when deserialization is finished.
The source of the deserialization event.
The <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> object that is associated with the current <xref href="System.Web.HttpApplicationStateWrapper"></xref> instance is invalid.
Removes the object specified by name from the collection.
The name of the object to remove from the collection.
Removes all objects from the collection.
Removes the object specified by index from the collection.
The position in the collection of the item to remove.
index is outside the valid range of indexes for the collection.
Updates the value of an object in the collection.
The name of the object to update.
The updated value of the object.
Gets all objects that are declared by an `object` element where the scope is set to "Application" in the ASP.NET application.
Application objects are defined in the Global.asax file inside an element that has syntax like the following:
A collection of objects in the application.
Gets an object that can be used to synchronize access to the collection.
An object that can be used to synchronize access to the collection.
Unlocks access to objects in the collection to enable synchronized access.
